cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"It is the duty of the strong to oppose any who threaten the weak."
—The Southern Paladin
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Flying

cards.name: Worship
cards.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
cards.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

cards.originalText: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Where psycho meets cyclone.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."
—Lewis Carroll,
Through the Looking Glass

rulings.text: If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
This is not considered a draw or a discard.

cards.originalText: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Arcane Laboratory
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor:
Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.
—Sign on entry to arcane lab

rulings.text: When Arcane Laboratory enters the battlefield, it will look back over the turn to see if any spell was cast before it entered the battlefield. It will notice itself being cast.
If a spell is countered, it still counts as the one spell cast.
When it leaves the battlefield, the effect ends and all players are able to cast spells unrestricted again.

cards.originalText: Each player can't play more than one spell each turn.

cards.name: Archivist
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."
cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Baleful Stare
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
cards.flavor: He can drown you in his eyes.
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each mountain and red card in it.

cards.name: Benthic Behemoth
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: The sea has many secrets, but some are too big to be kept.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)

cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser,
The Faerie Queene
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Confiscate
cards.text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

rulings.text: If you take control of an Aura, you do not get to move it.

cards.originalText: You control enchanted permanent.

cards.name: Coral Merfolk
cards.flavor: The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor:
"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

cards.originalText: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.name: Delusions of Mediocrity
cards.text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
cards.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.
cards.originalText:
When Delusions of Mediocrity comes into play, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves play, you lose 10 life.

cards.name: Equilibrium
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
The ability is put on the stack immediately after you cast a creature spell, which means the creature that spell will become won't be a legal target.
The ability will still resolve even if the spell that triggered it gets countered.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"How many people can you save in that thing?"
"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.
cards.originalText: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Fighting Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Fleeting Image
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"It was as if we fought a shadow."
—Onean soldier
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Force Spike
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "I don't think so."

rulings.text: The payment is optional.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
Like arguing with ice
—Vodalian expression meaning
"wasting your time"
cards.originalText: (Walls can't attack.)

cards.name: Hibernation
cards.text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.
cards.originalText: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards.

cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have flying.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
cards.originalText: All Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mana Breach
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land they control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.

rulings.text: The ability itself is controlled by Mana Breach's controller.
The person who cast the spell chooses which of their lands is affected.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.
cards.flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

rulings.text: Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

cards.originalText: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Mawcor
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

cards.name: Opportunity
cards.text: Target player draws four cards.
cards.flavor:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed
cards.originalText: Target player draws four cards.

cards.name: Opposition
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

Flying

Flying

cards.name: Sea Monster

cards.flavor: "Abandon ship!"
cards.originalText: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an island.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

cards.originalText: You control enchanted artifact.

cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

cards.name: Telepathic Spies
cards.text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.
cards.originalText: When Telepathic Spies comes into play, look at target opponent's hand.

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Temporal Adept
cards.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade
cards.originalText: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, you draw a card.

cards.name: Tolarian Winds
cards.text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor:
Why not ask the winds?
—Tolarian expression meaning
"Who knows?"

rulings.text: It counts how many cards you discard. Since this card will not be in your hand at that time, this card is not counted.

cards.originalText: Discard your hand, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo!"
cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
cards.flavor: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.

Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:

—Master wizard

(Walls can't attack.)
Flying

cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: They wondered at the size of it. It wondered which to eat first.

rulings.text: Paying to make the Wall capable of attacking does not override the normal rule that a creature may not attack unless it began your turn on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and may attack this turn as though it weren't a Wall.

cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The sky is her stage.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore,
"Oh that I had Wings"
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Abyssal Horror
cards.text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."
—Tolarian scholar
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror comes into play, target player discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Agonizing Memories
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I think little of the foes I've slain. But I'm haunted by the friends I've sent to die."
—The Southern Paladin
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.

cards.name: Befoul
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

rulings.text: This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Bellowing Fiend
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Bereavement
cards.text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

rulings.text: If the player has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

cards.originalText: Whenever a green creature is put into a graveyard from play, its controller discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Blood Pet
cards.text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: No thrull has ever been burdened with a long life.

rulings.text: Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Crypt Rats
cards.text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
cards.flavor:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying
cards.originalText: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana this way.

cards.name: Dakmor Lancer
cards.text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.
cards.originalText: When Dakmor Lancer comes into play, destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Hence 'banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
Romeo and Juliet
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Darkest Hour
cards.text: All creatures are black.
cards.flavor: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.

rulings.text: Affected creatures lose all other colors and are mono-black.

cards.originalText: All creatures are black.

cards.name: Dregs of Sorrow
cards.text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
cards.flavor:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

rulings.text: X can be zero.

cards.originalText: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
Necromancer's Handbook
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Eastern Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
cards.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.

cards.name: Engineered Plague
cards.text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
cards.flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.
cards.originalText:
As Engineered Plague comes into play, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
—Fallen angel, to Serra

rulings.text: Can sacrifice itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: "Booga booga booga!"
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The villagers call it "winged stench."

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Foul Imp comes into play, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Fugue
cards.text: Target player discards three cards.
cards.flavor:
"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin
cards.originalText: Target player discards three cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Giant Cockroach
cards.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Greed
cards.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine 'enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.
cards.originalText: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.originalText: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.flavor:
"East and West meet and angels cry.
Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

rulings.text: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.name: Leshrac's Rite
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Brackish water, dark and blind
Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It's unblockable as long as defending player controls a swamp.)

cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
cards.originalText: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Nausea
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Necrologia
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Draw X cards.

rulings.text: This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

cards.originalText:
Play Necrologia only during your end of turn step.
As an additional cost to play Necrologia, pay any amount of life.
Draw cards equal to the life paid this way.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of swamps you control.

cards.name: Nocturnal Raid
cards.text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

rulings.text: On resolution, all black creatures on the battlefield get the bonus. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

cards.originalText: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Oppression
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Ostracize
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "You won't be needing this."
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
